results.title: Tech Talk. Episodes 19 & 20.
results.creator_credit: John Kyle, Allenog Pty Ltd and Channel 0\28
results.brief_description: A compilation tape containing eight programmes designed to help young people in their carrer choices. There is also a segment on survival skills. Presented by Michael Shildberger, the topics covered are as follows:- surveyor, spray painter, painter and decorator, being out of work-the parents angle, computers - working in the industry, computers - the new age, florist and how to keep that job.

results.title: Tech talk. Episodes 17 & 18.
results.creator_credit: John Kyle, Allenog Pty Ltd and Channel 0\28
results.brief_description: A compilation tape containing eight programmes designed to help young people in their career choices. Details of what various jobs entail, the neccessary qualifications and how to go about getting the job are provided. There is also a segment on survival skills. Presented by Michael Schildberger the topics covered:- customs officer, interpreter, footwear trade/manufacture, unemployment benefits/money management, secretary, cartographer/map making, glazier and youth in danger/dangers of leaving home.

results.creator_credit: John Kyle, Allenog Pty Ltd and SBS-TV
results.brief_description: A compilation tape containing eight programmes designed to help young people in their career choices. The program is presented by Michael Schildberger

results.title: Backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly, freestyle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Swimming with Mark Tonelli”.
A compilation tape containing five programmes designed to instruct on swimming techniques. 1.Backstroke. Demonstrated by Commonwealth Gold Medallist Mark Tonelli. 2.Breaststroke. Demonstrated by British Gold Medallist Duncan Tonelli. 3.Butterfly. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli. 4. Freestyle. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli. 5.Starts and Turns. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli and Drew Mayhew.

results.title: Minga: we work together
results.creator_credit: Don Whyte and Reynolds Film Productions
results.brief_description: Presents aspects of the lives of South American Indians living in Northern Ecuador. Shows weaving (which is the main source of income), the sharing of resources within the community, the activities of the town’s market place and the types of housing and diet. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: A Place to work
results.creator_credit: M.J. Clark, W. J. Allen and J. Arthur Rank Organisation
results.brief_description: Part of the “Patterns of living” series. Looks at Luxembourg’s iron and steel industry, Danish ship-building, Scottish fish processing, Swiss watch making and British car assembly to demonstrate the range and complexity of factors affecting the location of modern manufacturing industries. Considers transport costs, industrial inertia, decline and regeneration of industry. Useful as a resource for studies relating to manufacturing locations. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Leah; Water rats; Alison; Tracey
results.creator_credit: Sabina Baltrukomis and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: A compilation tape consisting of four programmes designed to promote discussion in the area of human relations. 1. Leah. Concerns the feelings of an adolescent girl in regard to her alcoholic father who embarrasses her in front of her friends. 2. Water rats. Looks at the peer pressure exerted amongst a group of adolescents to conform to the group’s standards. 3. Alison. Looks at the problems of an adolescent girl who cannot adjust to her single father’s need to have adult female companionship. 4 Tracey. Considers the situation of an adolescent girl subjected to pressure by her domineering father to perform well academically.

results.title: Fatness, foods, fads (compilation)
results.brief_description: Fatness, foods and fads outlines the 5 food groups and examines the fallacies of diets such as the Israeli army diet, the no carbohydrate diet, the grapefruit diet and the macrobiotic diet. 2. “Energy, food and exercise” shows how to achieve a proper balance of food and exercise for particular needs. 3.”Whats cooking” highlights the health problems that abound in the unhygienic kitchen and poses solutions. Compared by Andrew Daddo.
